issue.title: [RFC] Error handling -- partial data

comment.body:
I like `@catch`! It allows you to decide if/where you want to deal with partial results.

To be discussed: for apps that _never_ want partial results, we could think of a global setting where `data` is a Result too, to avoid having to set `@catch` on all queries.

Tangential remark: if we feel `errors` vs `exception` contributes to the confusion, we could remove (well, deprecate first!) `errors`, let GraphQL errors only be surfaced in `exception` as `ApolloGraphQLException`?

comment.body: What if you put all your plugins in the root `build.gradle.kts` (with apply false)? Usually that does the trick for me as Gradle does proper conflict resolution in that case. But yea not much we can do from our side.

issue.title: 4.0.0 alpha.3 -> beta.1 KotlinPoet error
issue.body:
### Version

4.0.0-beta.2

### Summary

Build error when updating from alpha.3 to beta.1 (or beta.2). I have no idea what this is or what the error message means. It's possible this is an incompatibility with AGP 8.3.0-alpha10 or Gradle 8.4.

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

My project is open source at https://github.com/TheKeeperOfPie/ArtistAlleyDatabase. Although I've never tried to build it from a fresh checkout, so there is definitely some configuration and steps that aren't described well or set up. Feel free to ping me on Discord (same username `@thekeeperofpie`) if you need a better isolated project.

1. Bump the `apollo` version in `versions.gradle.kts`
2. `./gradlew --dependency-verification off :modules:anilist-data:generateAnilistApolloSources `

comment.body: Huh, interesting. Unfortunately that workaround causes a code generation issue with Netflix's DGS, no doubt due to the same KotlinPoet conflict. I probably just have to wait for all dependencies to migrate to 1.14. But thanks for the response. Definitely doesn't look like an Apollo issue, so I'll close.

issue.title: Add WebSocket support to the MockServer
issue.body:
Implement reading/writing websocket frames so the only expect/actual things we need is the Socket.

There are still a bunch of undefined behaviours around the semantics of closing a server (see https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KTOR-6406, also some JS tests are still disabled). But we're slowly getting there

issue.title: Make test pass if plugin relocation is disabled
issue.body: Locally I have `APOLLO_RELOCATE_JAR=false` in my env to iterate faster but some tests rely on that (for good reasons). It's not the stuff that changes a lot though so for the purpose of local iterations, allow to skip those tests, volkswagen CI style.
